> Sunhawk picked up the transmission and smiled.
>
> Sunhawk:  Nevermind what I said SIR!  But I still want
> to destroy that Predicon now.
>
> He continued waiting for an answer.
>

{Talos}

    When Sunhawk had barged in Talos had looked up from what he was
studying, in his hand was a small buckler sized chunk of metal, one side was
detailed in pink and white with several faded splotches of red. Setting the
object aside and turning to regard Sunhawk he sighed.

    "We will not be executing anyone Sunhawk. Not these predicons or any
other. Our mission is to capture...not serve as judge jury and executioner.
That's not our way, at least not mine. Escort Arc..I mean, Nightshade here
to some quarters...and I do mean quarters not the brig Sunhawk, when Hot Rod
returns from gathering the stasis pods he'll be assigned the duty of keeping
an eye on her."

    Turning to pick up the peice of metal he looked down upon the insignia
upon it, even the wear of time could not remove it completely and he had
verified it's authenticity. Nightshade for all practical terms was what she
had claimed to be. Maybe it was a mistake assigning Hot Rod to watch her,
but he'd be able to tell if Nightshade was really the autobot Arcee or
not...

    "Dismissed" He said simply, flipping the peice of metal back to it's
owner.

    Nightshade smiled and caught the metal lifting her chest plate slightly
and slipping it back into a compartment within as she stood and turned to
Sunhawk, "We meet again and without you trying to kill me no less..."
